* To ensure maximum participation and make the initiative a success, there are several key things that I would need to consider when implementing GMI's leadership development program for the ad agency:
* Clearly communicate the goals and objectives of the program to all managers, and how it aligns with the overall strategy and goals of the agency.
* Encourage managers to actively participate in the program and provide them with the necessary resources and support to do so.
* Ensure that the program is tailored to the specific needs of the ad agency and its managers, taking into account the agency's culture and specific challenges.
* Provide regular feedback and progress updates to managers, as well as coaching and mentoring to help them achieve the goals of the program.
* Allow managers to share their own experiences, successes, and challenges in the program, to encourage engagement and collaboration among the managers.
* Recognize and reward managers who achieve the goals of the program, and celebrate successes.
* Ensure that the program is well-coordinated and executed across all offices of the ad agency, to ensure consistency and alignment.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate the program's progress, and make adjustments as needed to ensure that it is meeting its goals and driving the desired outcomes.
* Engage the support of the agency's leadership team to demonstrate the importance and value of the program and encourage participation.
* Provide flexible options for managers to participate in the program, like virtual sessions, in case of any restrictions or difficulties in attending in-person sessions.
